post.summary: Append content to an existing wiki page

400.description: Circular reference detected or parent not found

get.summary: List all MCP servers with pagination
Get MCP server by UUID or provided ID

delete.summary: Delete MCP server (must have no dependencies)

post.summary: Create MCP scope(s) for a server

get.summary: List all scopes for an MCP server

delete.summary: Delete MCP scope (must have no mappings)

post.summary: Create OAuth connection for an MCP server

get.summary: List all connections for an MCP server
List downstream scopes for an MCP scope

post.description: Implements RFC 7591 Dynamic Client Registration for OAuth 2.0. Validates client metadata, generates credentials, and persists the client configuration. Requires authorization_code and refresh_token grant types with PKCE support per MCP specification.

201.description: Client registered successfully with generated credentials

400.description: Invalid client metadata (missing fields, invalid redirect URIs, unsupported grant types, or PKCE not configured)

409.description: A client with this name is already registered

post.summary: Register a new OAuth 2.0 client (Dynamic Client Registration)

get.description: Returns the registration metadata for a client. The client_secret is NOT included in the response for security reasons.
Returns a list of all registered OAuth clients. Intended for administrative purposes. Client secrets are not included.
Handles authorization requests from MCP clients. Validates the request, stores PKCE parameters, and redirects to the consent screen UI.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: OAuth 2.0 response type (must be "code" for authorization code flow)

parameters.name: code_challenge
parameters.description: PKCE code challenge derived from the code verifier

parameters.name: code_challenge_method
parameters.description: PKCE code challenge method (S256 for SHA-256)

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: Redirect URI where the authorization response will be sent

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Opaque state value for CSRF protection

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Resource server URL that the client wants to access

302.description: Redirects to consent screen with authorization request ID

404.description: MCP server or client not found

post.description: Handles user consent decision. Validates the flow ID (CSRF token), generates an authorization code if approved, and redirects back to the client with the code or error.

302.description: Redirects to client redirect_uri with authorization code or error

400.description: Invalid consent decision or flow state

401.description: Authorization flow has already been used

get.description: Retrieves authorization flow details for the consent screen

post.description: Exchanges authorization code for access token. Validates PKCE code_verifier, issues signed JWT access token and refresh token.

401.description: Invalid authorization code, code_verifier, or expired code

post.description: Introspects an access token to validate it and retrieve its metadata. Verifies JWT signature, expiration, and claims according to RFC 7662.

200.description: Token introspection response (active true/false with metadata)

post.description: Exchanges MCP JWT access token for downstream system tokens. Validates MCP token, resolves scope mappings, and returns downstream access token with automatic refresh if needed.

200.description: Token exchange successful - returns downstream access token

403.description: Insufficient scope - requested scope not entitled

get.description: Handles callbacks from downstream OAuth providers. Validates the state, exchanges authorization code for tokens, and continues the auth flow.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Authorization code from downstream OAuth provider

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State parameter that identifies the connection flow

302.description: Redirects to next step in the authorization flow

404.description: Connection flow not found for provided state

get.summary: OAuth 2.0 Callback Endpoint for Downstream Systems

get.description: Returns the public keys used to verify JWT signatures. This endpoint provides all valid (non-expired) keys to support key rotation.
Provides discovery metadata (RFC 8414) for OAuth 2.0 clients integrating with a specific MCP server version. Accepts either the server UUID or the providedId.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Semantic version of the MCP server

get.summary: Expose OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server metadata for a registered MCP server version
List agents with optional filtering and pagination
Get an agent by ID or slug
List sessions for an app and user

post.summary: Send a message to an ADK agent (non-streaming)

get.summary: Send a message to an ADK agent with SSE streaming
List chat sessions with optional filtering and pagination
Get a chat session by ID

post.summary: Send a message to the ADK agent (non-streaming)
Send a message to the ADK agent with streaming response

parentId.description: Parent page ID (null to remove parent)

newParentId.description: New parent page ID (null to move to root)

color.description: Color for the tag (hex format). If not provided, a random color will be assigned.

id.description: System-generated UUID for the MCP server

providedId.description: Human-readable unique identifier for the MCP server

name.description: Display name of the MCP server

description.description: Short description of the MCP server
description.example: Provides access to GitHub repositories and issues

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the server was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the server was last updated

message.description: Confirmation message indicating the server was deleted

description.description: Description of what this scope grants access to
Description of what this scope allows

serverId.description: UUID of the MCP server this scope belongs to

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the scope was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the scope was last updated

message.description: Confirmation message indicating the scope was deleted

friendlyName.description: Friendly name to identify this OAuth connection

providedId.description: Unique identifier for this connection (alphanumeric, dash, underscore only). Used for token exchange.

clientId.description: OAuth client ID for the downstream provider

clientSecret.description: OAuth client secret for the downstream provider

serverId.description: UUID of the MCP server this connection belongs to

friendlyName.description: Friendly name for operators to distinguish connections

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the connection was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the connection was last updated

friendlyName.description: Friendly name to identify this OAuth connection

providedId.description: Unique identifier for this connection (alphanumeric, dash, underscore only). Used for token exchange.

clientId.description: OAuth client ID for the downstream provider

clientSecret.description: OAuth client secret for the downstream provider

message.description: Confirmation message indicating the connection was deleted

scopeId.description: MCP scope ID to map from

connectionId.description: Connection ID that owns this mapping
UUID of the downstream OAuth connection

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the mapping was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the mapping was last updated

message.description: Confirmation message indicating the mapping was deleted

redirect_uris.description: Array of redirect URIs for authorization callbacks (supports http and localhost for MCP clients)

token_endpoint_auth_method.description: Authentication method for the token endpoint (MCP clients use "none")

grant_types.description: Grant types the client will use. Must include authorization_code and refresh_token per MCP requirements.

response_types.description: Array of the OAuth 2.0 response type strings that the client can use at the authorization endpoint.

contacts.description: Contact emails for the client registration

tos_uri.description: Terms of service URI for the client registration

redirect_uris.description: Array of redirect URIs for authorization callbacks (supports http and localhost for MCP clients)

grant_types.description: Grant types the client is authorized to use

token_endpoint_auth_method.description: Authentication method for the token endpoint (MCP clients use "none")

client_id_issued_at.description: Time at which the client identifier was issued. The time is represented as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z as measured in UTC until the date/time of issuance.

flow_id.description: Authorization flow ID (serves as CSRF protection token)

approved.description: Whether the user approved the authorization request

grant_type.description: Grant type that determines which parameters must be supplied

client_id.description: Client identifier issued during dynamic registration

code.description: Authorization code that was issued by the /authorize endpoint

redirect_uri.description: Redirect URI used during authorization (required when code is present)

code_verifier.description: PKCE code verifier used to validate the authorization code exchange

refresh_token.description: Refresh token issued earlier by the authorization server

scope.description: Optional list of scopes to narrow when refreshing a token (space-delimited)

resource.description: Optional resource indicator (RFC 8707) - identifies the target resource server

access_token.description: Opaque access token used to access protected resources

token_type.description: Type of token issued (MCP clients always receive Bearer tokens)

expires_in.description: Lifetime of the access token in seconds

refresh_token.description: Refresh token that can be exchanged for a new access token

scope.description: Space-delimited scopes that were granted for this token

token.description: Access or refresh token that should be validated

token_type_hint.description: Hint to help the server determine the token lookup strategy

client_id.description: Client identifier making the request (required for public MCP clients)

client_secret.description: Client secret for confidential clients (MCP clients typically omit this)

active.description: Indicates whether the token is currently valid

token_type.description: Token type, always Bearer for MCP clients

client_id.description: Client identifier associated with the token

sub.description: Subject of the token (resource owner or actor)

aud.description: Audience that should accept this token

jti.description: Unique token identifier for replay detection

server_identifier.description: MCP server identifier the token is scoped to

resource.description: Resource URL that was used during authorization

version.description: Version of the MCP server contract

kty.description: Key type, for example RSA or EC.

use.description: Key usage indicating how the key can be used.

kid.description: Unique identifier for the key used for rotation.

alg.description: Algorithm intended for use with this key.

e.description: RSA public exponent encoded using base64url.

x.description: Public coordinate X for EC keys encoded using base64url.

y.description: Public coordinate Y for EC keys encoded using base64url.

keys.description: Collection of JSON Web Keys currently valid for signature verification.

issuer.description: Issuer identifier for the MCP authorization server

authorization_endpoint.description: Authorization endpoint for initiating OAuth 2.0 authorization code flows

token_endpoint.description: Token endpoint for exchanging OAuth 2.0 authorization codes

registration_endpoint.description: Dynamic client registration endpoint for MCP integrations

scopes_supported.description: Scopes supported by this MCP authorization server

response_types_supported.description: OAuth 2.0 response types supported by this authorization server

grant_types_supported.description: OAuth 2.0 grant types supported by this authorization server

token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported.description: Client authentication methods supported by the token endpoint

code_challenge_methods_supported.description: PKCE code challenge methods supported by this authorization server

slug.description: Unique, human-readable identifier for the agent

description.description: Short description of what this agent does

systemPrompt.example: You are a helpful assistant that helps users with tasks.

allowedTools.description: List of tool identifiers this agent is allowed to use

isActive.description: Whether this agent is available for assignment

concurrencyLimit.description: Max number of tasks this agent can process in parallel

apps.description: List of available ADK app names

id.description: Unique identifier for the function call

name.description: Name of the function being called

id.description: Unique identifier for the function response

name.description: Name of the function that was called

text.description: Text content of the message part
text.example: Hello, how can I help you?

functionCall.description: Function call data if this part is a function call

functionResponse.description: Function response data if this part is a function response

role.description: Role of the message author (user, agent, system)

promptTokenCount.description: Number of tokens in the prompt

candidatesTokenCount.description: Number of tokens in the candidates

id.description: Unique identifier for the chat event

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when the event occurred

author.description: Author of the event (user ID or agent ID)

partial.description: Whether this is a partial event (streaming)

invocationId.description: Invocation identifier for the chat turn

usageMetadata.description: Token usage metadata for the event

userId.description: User ID associated with the session

events.description: List of chat events in the session

lastUpdateTime.description: Unix timestamp of the last update to the session

events.description: List of chat events generated from sending the message

agentId.description: ID of the agent for this chat session

project.description: Optional project label for this session

project.description: Optional project label for this session

lastMessageAt.description: Timestamp of the last message in this chat

subscribedTasks.description: Tasks subscribed to in this session

total.description: Total number of sessions matching the filters

project.description: Optional project label for this session

isArchived.description: Whether the session should be archived

isPinned.description: Whether the session should be pinned
